pageContext.claim: “Of course, didn't they say that President Clinton, when he went on the back of the plane and was here to play golf, it was 121 degrees that day. What do you think he was doing with the attorney general? Remember, he said, 'Oh, I just happened to see she was a -- I was here to play golf. It was 120 degrees out.' I don't know. A lot of crooked stuff went on.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump without any evidence suggests corrupt dealings between former President Bill Clinton and former Attorney General Loretta Lynch. The FBI was investigating Hillary Clinton in 2016 and there's no evidence they went easy on Clinton because of some order from Lynch. In fact, many observers say the FBI's repeated announcements about Clinton's handling of her emails served to prejudice voters against her. Trump sometimes claims he fired former FBI Director James Comey for these unprecedented interventions in a presidential election.
